Welcome to cardlib’s documentation!¶

Dat 171, Computer Assignment 2, written by John Carlsson and Derin Ismail, spring of 2022

class cardlib.AceCard(suit)¶

Bases: cardlib.PlayingCard

A class for the aces in deck of cards, value is set at 14, since Aces are normaly seen as the most valuable card.

get_suit()¶

Returns the suit of the card

get_value()¶

Return the cards value

class cardlib.Hand¶

Bases: object

A players hand containing any number of cards

add_card(card)¶

Add cards to hand

best_poker_hand(cards=[])¶

Compute the best possible hand with your current cards

Args:
cards

A list of cards. Defaults to an empty list: [].

Returns:
PokerHand

A pokerhand object of the best hand

drop_cards(index) → list¶

Drop one or several cards by index

sort()¶

Sort the hand from smallest to largest

class cardlib.HandType(value)¶

Bases: enum.IntEnum

A class for the different type of pokerhands

class cardlib.NumberedCard(value, suit)¶

Bases: cardlib.PlayingCard

A class for the numbered playingcards in a deck of cards, value can be between 2 and 10

get_suit()¶

Returns the suit of the card

get_value()¶

Return the cards value

class cardlib.PlayingCard(suit)¶

Bases: object

A class for the playingcards in a standard deck of 52 cards

Args:
metaclass

Defaults to ABCMeta.

abstract get_suit()¶

Returns the suit of the card

abstract get_value()¶

Return the cards value

class cardlib.StandardDeck¶

Bases: object

A standard deck of 52 cards

draw()¶

Draw the top card from the deck

shuffle()¶

Shuffle the deck

class cardlib.Suit(value)¶

Bases: enum.IntEnum

A class for the suits in a deck of cards

Args:
enum

To make it possible to iterate and value the suits

cardlib.flush(cards) → list¶

A function checking if a flush can be made with the given cards Args: :cards: A list of PlayingCard objects

Returns: :tuple: A Handtype for the pokerhand and a list of the cards making up the flush in falling order

cardlib.four_of_a_kind(cards)¶

A function checking if a four of kind can be made with the given cards

Args: :cards: A list of PlayingCard objects Returns: :tuple: A Handtype for the pokerhand and a a tuple of the card thats a four of a kind and a list of all the cards in the hand in falling order

cardlib.full_house(cards)¶

A function checking if a full house can be made with the given cards

Args: :cards: A list of PlayingCard objects

Returns: :tuple: A Handtype for the pokerhand and a a tuple of the cards that make up the full house and a list of all the cards in the hand in falling order

cardlib.high_card(cards)¶

A function checking if a pair can be made with the given cards Args: :cards: A list of PlayingCard objects Returns: :tuple: A Handtype for the pokerhand and a list of all the cards in the hand in falling order

cardlib.pair(cards)¶

A function checking if a pair can be made with the given cards Args: :param cards: A list of PlayingCard objects Returns: :HandType:, :tuple: A Handtype for the pokerhand and a tuple of the value of the pair and a list of all the cards in the hand in falling order

cardlib.royal_flush(cards)¶

A function for checking if a Royal flush can be created with the cards given

Args:
param cards

A list of PlayingCard objects

Returns:
HandType:, :list

a HandType object and a list of cards

cardlib.straight(cards)¶

A function checking if a straight can be made with the given cards Args: :cards: A list of PlayingCard objects

Returns: :tuple: A Handtype for the pokerhand and a list of all the cards in the hand in falling order

cardlib.straight_flush(cards)¶

Checks for the best straight flush in a list of cards (may be more than just 5) :param cards: A list of playing cards. :return: None if no straight flush is found, else the value of the top card and the cards in hand

cardlib.three_of_a_kind(cards)¶

A function checking if three of a kind can be made with the given cards Args: :cards: A list of PlayingCard objects

Returns: :tuple: A Handtype for the pokerhand and a a tuple of the value fpr the three of a kind and a list of all the cards in the hand in falling order

cardlib.two_pairs(cards)¶

A function checking if two pairs can be made with the given cards Args :cards: A list of PlayingCard objects Return: :tuple: A Handtype for the pokerhand and a tuple of the value of the pairs and a list of all the cards in the hand in falling order
